title: 111_hr3282
content: The program provides readjustment and mental health care services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs shall establish a program to provide peer outreach, support, counseling, and mental health services to veterans of Operation Iraqi Freedom and Operation Enduring Freedom, as well as education and support for their immediate family members. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will contract with community mental health centers and qualified entities to provide counseling and mental health services for veterans transitioning to civilian life, recovering from injuries or illnesses, and for their families. The services will be provided in areas not adequately served by VA health care facilities, with a focus on employing trained veterans and utilizing telehealth services. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will contract with community health centers or entities to provide services for veterans, including employing trained veterans, using telehealth services, participating in training programs, complying with VA protocols, and submitting annual reports on services provided. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will contract with community health centers to provide mental health services for veterans, including training programs for veterans and clinicians, submitting clinical summary information, and meeting other requirements as needed. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will conduct training programs for veterans and clinicians to provide mental health services, focusing on the unique experiences of veterans who served in Operation Iraqi Freedom or Operation Enduring Freedom. Additionally, reports on the implementation plan will be submitted to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will submit reports to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs regarding the implementation of the program for mental health services for veterans who served in Operation Iraqi Freedom or Operation Enduring Freedom. The reports will include information on the number of veterans receiving services and an evaluation of the services provided. The Secretary of Veterans Affairs will submit reports to the Committees on Veterans' Affairs evaluating the provision of mental health services for veterans who served in Operation Iraqi Freedom or Operation Enduring Freedom. The report will include an assessment of services provided, recommendations on extending service periods, a list of national mental health organizations offering services, and an evaluation of training programs.
